meanings.definition: To make colorless or remove color from
meanings.sent1: The artist achromatized the painting by using only black and white colors.
meanings.sent2: The chemist achromatized the solution by adding a decolorizing agent.
meanings.sent3: The magician achromatized the rainbow, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The storm achromatized the sky, turning it a dull gray.
meanings.sent5: The bleach achromatized the fabric, leaving it completely white.

meanings.sent1: The achromatized photograph looked like an old black and white movie.
meanings.sent2: The achromatized room felt cold and sterile without any colorful decorations.
meanings.sent3: The achromatized world in the dream seemed strangely peaceful.
meanings.sent4: Her achromatized outfit made her stand out in the colorful crowd.
meanings.sent5: The achromatized landscape was hauntingly beautiful in its simplicity.
